        Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6184247906992128<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6184247906992128"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6184247906992128<!----></a><br><br>Fuzzer: None<span class="line"><!---->Fuzzer: None<!----></span><br>Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_mp<span class="line"><!---->Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_mp<!----></span><br>Platform Id: linux<span class="line"><!---->Platform Id: linux<!----></span><br><br>Crash Type: UNKNOWN WRITE<span class="line"><!---->Crash Type: UNKNOWN WRITE<!----></span><br>Crash Address: 0x7d8c00004088<span class="line"><!---->Crash Address: 0x7d8c00004088<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>  v8::internal::JSObject::WriteToField<span class="line"><!---->  v8::internal::JSObject::WriteToField<!----></span><br>  v8::internal::CommitProperties<span class="line"><!---->  v8::internal::CommitProperties<!----></span><br>  v8::internal::ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties<span class="line"><!---->  v8::internal::ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>Sanitizer: address (ASAN)<span class="line"><!---->Sanitizer: address (ASAN)<!----></span><br><br>Recommended Security Severity: High<span class="line"><!---->Recommended Security Severity: High<!----></span><br><br>Crash Revision: <span class="line"><!---->Crash Revision: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&revision=1100700<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&amp;revision=1100700"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&amp;revision=1100700<!----></a><br><br>Reproducer Testcase: <span class="line"><!---->Reproducer Testcase: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6184247906992128<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6184247906992128"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6184247906992128<!----></a><br><br>To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary. <span class="line"><!---->To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary. <!----></span><br><br>If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.<span class="line"><!---->If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.<!----></span><br><br>If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at <span class="line"><!---->If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at <!----></span>https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5"><!---->https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5<!----></a> so we can improve.<span class="line"><!----> so we can improve.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        ishell: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->ishell: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time!         This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M110. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<span class="line"><!---->This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

        <tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>

            padding: 0;

          }

          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

          <aside class="metadata-container">

    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <mr-edit-description id="edit-description"></mr-edit-description>
        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>
        <mr-convert-issue id="convert-issue"></mr-convert-issue>
        <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>
        <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-page>
        <!----></main>
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>
    <!----></mr-app>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

                  <!---->:

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      Vulnerability Details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability Details<!----></span><br><br>When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Maybe<uint32_t> ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<span class="line"><!---->Maybe&lt;uint32_t&gt; ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<!----></span><br>    Handle<JSObject> object, SerializationTag end_tag,<span class="line"><!---->    Handle&lt;JSObject&gt; object, SerializationTag end_tag,<!----></span><br>    bool can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->    bool can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  // Fast path (following map transitions).<span class="line"><!---->  // Fast path (following map transitions).<!----></span><br>  if (can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    while (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->    while (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>      ...<span class="line"><!---->      ...<!----></span><br>      } else {<span class="line"><!---->      } else {<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>        if (key->IsString(isolate_)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (key-&gt;IsString(isolate_)) {<!----></span><br>          key =<span class="line"><!---->          key =<!----></span><br>              isolate_->factory()->InternalizeString(Handle<String>::cast(key));<span class="line"><!---->              isolate_-&gt;factory()-&gt;InternalizeString(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key));<!----></span><br>          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<span class="line"><!---->          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<!----></span><br>          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<!----></span><br>                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle<String>::cast(key))<span class="line"><!---->                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key))<!----></span><br>                              .ToHandle(&target);                                  //<------ 1.<span class="line"><!---->                              .ToHandle(&amp;target);                                  //&lt;------ 1.<!----></span><br>        } else {<span class="line"><!---->        } else {<!----></span><br>          transitioning = false;<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<span class="line"><!---->      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<!----></span><br>      Handle<Object> value;<span class="line"><!---->      Handle&lt;Object&gt; value;<!----></span><br>      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&value)) return Nothing<uint32_t>();             //<------- 2.<span class="line"><!---->      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&amp;value)) return Nothing&lt;uint32_t&gt;();             //&lt;------- 2.<!----></span><br><br>      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<span class="line"><!---->      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<!----></span><br>      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<span class="line"><!---->      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<!----></span><br>      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<span class="line"><!---->      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<!----></span><br>      if (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<span class="line"><!---->        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<!----></span><br>        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<span class="line"><!---->        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<!----></span><br>        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //<-------- 3.<span class="line"><!---->        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //&lt;-------- 3.<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br><br>      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //<-------- 4.<span class="line"><!---->      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //&lt;-------- 4.<!----></span><br>      num_properties = static_cast<uint32_t>(properties.size());<span class="line"><!---->      num_properties = static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(properties.size());<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<span class="line"><!---->At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<!----></span><br>1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<span class="line"><!---->1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<!----></span><br>2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<span class="line"><!---->2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<!----></span><br><br>A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<span class="line"><!---->A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<!----></span><br>1. Create two objects with the following structure:<span class="line"><!---->1. Create two objects with the following structure:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj.c = {};<span class="line"><!---->obj.c = {};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<span class="line"><!---->This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<span class="line"><!---->Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr0 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr0 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr0.a1 = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->arr0.a1 = 1.1;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<span class="line"><!---->and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr_i = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr_i = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr_i.a1 = 1;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i.a1 = 1;<!----></span><br>arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Then create a message object as an array:<span class="line"><!---->Then create a message object as an array:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>[obj0, obj1] <span class="line"><!---->[obj0, obj1] <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>where `obj1` is:<span class="line"><!---->where `obj1` is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj1 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj1 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj1.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj1.c = arr;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.c = arr;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<span class="line"><!---->and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<!----></span><br><br>When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<span class="line"><!---->in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<span class="line"><!---->MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<span class="line"><!---->      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<!----></span><br>    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <span class="line"><!---->    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d<a <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/map-updater.cc;l=275<a class="undefined" Case<span class="line"><!---->Reproduction Case<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>./d8 test_ser.js<span class="line"><!---->./d8 test_ser.js<!----></span><br>```<span (latest release)<span class="line"><!---->The attached `test_ser.html` is also tested on the official build of Chrome version 109.0.5414.119. (latest release)<!----></span><br><br>This should cause a crash.<span class="line"><!---->This should cause a crash.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          min-height: 100%;

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    text-decoration: underline;

  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    align-items: flex-start;

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          
            Close
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>
