        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
      Vulnerability Details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability Details<!----></span><br><br>When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Maybe<uint32_t> ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<span class="line"><!---->Maybe&lt;uint32_t&gt; ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<!----></span><br>    Handle<JSObject> object, SerializationTag end_tag,<span class="line"><!---->    Handle&lt;JSObject&gt; object, SerializationTag end_tag,<!----></span><br>    bool can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->    bool can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  // Fast path (following map transitions).<span class="line"><!---->  // Fast path (following map transitions).<!----></span><br>  if (can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    while (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->    while (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>      ...<span class="line"><!---->      ...<!----></span><br>      } else {<span class="line"><!---->      } else {<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>        if (key->IsString(isolate_)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (key-&gt;IsString(isolate_)) {<!----></span><br>          key =<span class="line"><!---->          key =<!----></span><br>              isolate_->factory()->InternalizeString(Handle<String>::cast(key));<span class="line"><!---->              isolate_-&gt;factory()-&gt;InternalizeString(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key));<!----></span><br>          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<span class="line"><!---->          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<!----></span><br>          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<!----></span><br>                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle<String>::cast(key))<span class="line"><!---->                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key))<!----></span><br>                              .ToHandle(&target);                                  //<------ 1.<span class="line"><!---->                              .ToHandle(&amp;target);                                  //&lt;------ 1.<!----></span><br>        } else {<span class="line"><!---->        } else {<!----></span><br>          transitioning = false;<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<span class="line"><!---->      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<!----></span><br>      Handle<Object> value;<span class="line"><!---->      Handle&lt;Object&gt; value;<!----></span><br>      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&value)) return Nothing<uint32_t>();             //<------- 2.<span class="line"><!---->      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&amp;value)) return Nothing&lt;uint32_t&gt;();             //&lt;------- 2.<!----></span><br><br>      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<span class="line"><!---->      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<!----></span><br>      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<span class="line"><!---->      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<!----></span><br>      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<span class="line"><!---->      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<!----></span><br>      if (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<span class="line"><!---->        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<!----></span><br>        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<span class="line"><!---->        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<!----></span><br>        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //<-------- 3.<span class="line"><!---->        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //&lt;-------- 3.<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br><br>      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //<-------- 4.<span class="line"><!---->      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //&lt;-------- 4.<!----></span><br>      num_properties = static_cast<uint32_t>(properties.size());<span class="line"><!---->      num_properties = static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(properties.size());<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<span class="line"><!---->At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<!----></span><br>1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<span class="line"><!---->1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<!----></span><br>2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<span class="line"><!---->2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<!----></span><br><br>A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<span class="line"><!---->A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<!----></span><br>1. Create two objects with the following structure:<span class="line"><!---->1. Create two objects with the following structure:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj.c = {};<span class="line"><!---->obj.c = {};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<span class="line"><!---->This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<span class="line"><!---->Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr0 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr0 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr0.a1 = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->arr0.a1 = 1.1;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<span class="line"><!---->and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr_i = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr_i = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr_i.a1 = 1;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i.a1 = 1;<!----></span><br>arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Then create a message object as an array:<span class="line"><!---->Then create a message object as an array:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>[obj0, obj1] <span class="line"><!---->[obj0, obj1] <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>where `obj1` is:<span class="line"><!---->where `obj1` is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj1 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj1 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj1.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj1.c = arr;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.c = arr;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<span class="line"><!---->and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<!----></span><br><br>When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<span class="line"><!---->in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<span class="line"><!---->MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<span class="line"><!---->      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<!----></span><br>    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <span class="line"><!---->    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407<a           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Questionnaire 1:<span class="line"><!---->Questionnaire 1:<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1. We haven't heard of any stability regressions.<span class="line"><!---->Low stability risk. We haven't heard of any stability regressions.<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      m-y...@github.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/404590096" title="m-y...@github.com"><!---->m-y...@github.com<!----></a>

      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Thu, Feb 2, 2023, 12:46 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 2, 2023, 12:46 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 2, 2023, 12:46 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 2, 2023, 12:46 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>

          <h1>
            
            Issue 1412487: Security: Type confusion in v8 value serializer
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by

      </div>
      Vulnerability Details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability Details<!----></span><br><br>When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Maybe<uint32_t> ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<span class="line"><!---->Maybe&lt;uint32_t&gt; ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<!----></span><br>    Handle<JSObject> object, SerializationTag end_tag,<span class="line"><!---->    Handle&lt;JSObject&gt; object, SerializationTag end_tag,<!----></span><br>    bool can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->    bool can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  // Fast path (following map transitions).<span class="line"><!---->  // Fast path (following map transitions).<!----></span><br>  if (can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    while (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->    while (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>      ...<span class="line"><!---->      ...<!----></span><br>      } else {<span class="line"><!---->      } else {<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>        if (key->IsString(isolate_)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (key-&gt;IsString(isolate_)) {<!----></span><br>          key =<span class="line"><!---->          key =<!----></span><br>              isolate_->factory()->InternalizeString(Handle<String>::cast(key));<span class="line"><!---->              isolate_-&gt;factory()-&gt;InternalizeString(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key));<!----></span><br>          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<span class="line"><!---->          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<!----></span><br>          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<!----></span><br>                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle<String>::cast(key))<span class="line"><!---->                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key))<!----></span><br>                              .ToHandle(&target);                                  //<------ 1.<span class="line"><!---->                              .ToHandle(&amp;target);                                  //&lt;------ 1.<!----></span><br>        } else {<span class="line"><!---->        } else {<!----></span><br>          transitioning = false;<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<span class="line"><!---->      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<!----></span><br>      Handle<Object> value;<span class="line"><!---->      Handle&lt;Object&gt; value;<!----></span><br>      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&value)) return Nothing<uint32_t>();             //<------- 2.<span class="line"><!---->      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&amp;value)) return Nothing&lt;uint32_t&gt;();             //&lt;------- 2.<!----></span><br><br>      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<span class="line"><!---->      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<!----></span><br>      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<span class="line"><!---->      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<!----></span><br>      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<span class="line"><!---->      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<!----></span><br>      if (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<span class="line"><!---->        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<!----></span><br>        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<span class="line"><!---->        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<!----></span><br>        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //<-------- 3.<span class="line"><!---->        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //&lt;-------- 3.<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br><br>      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //<-------- 4.<span class="line"><!---->      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //&lt;-------- 4.<!----></span><br>      num_properties = static_cast<uint32_t>(properties.size());<span class="line"><!---->      num_properties = static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(properties.size());<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<span class="line"><!---->At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<!----></span><br>1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<span class="line"><!---->1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<!----></span><br>2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<span class="line"><!---->2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<!----></span><br><br>A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<span class="line"><!---->A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<!----></span><br>1. Create two objects with the following structure:<span class="line"><!---->1. Create two objects with the following structure:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj.c = {};<span class="line"><!---->obj.c = {};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<span class="line"><!---->This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<span class="line"><!---->Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr0 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr0 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr0.a1 = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->arr0.a1 = 1.1;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<span class="line"><!---->and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr_i = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr_i = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr_i.a1 = 1;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i.a1 = 1;<!----></span><br>arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Then create a message object as an array:<span class="line"><!---->Then create a message object as an array:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>[obj0, obj1] <span class="line"><!---->[obj0, obj1] <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>where `obj1` is:<span class="line"><!---->where `obj1` is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj1 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj1 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj1.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj1.c = arr;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.c = arr;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<span class="line"><!---->and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<!----></span><br><br>When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<span class="line"><!---->in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<span class="line"><!---->MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<span class="line"><!---->      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<!----></span><br>    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <span class="line"><!---->    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d<!----></a><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/map-updater.cc;l=275<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Case<span class="line"><!---->Reproduction Case<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>./d8 test_ser.js<span class="line"><!---->./d8 test_ser.js<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The attached `test_ser.html` is also tested on the official build of Chrome version 109.0.5414.119. (latest release)<span class="line"><!---->The attached `test_ser.html` is also tested on the official build of Chrome version 109.0.5414.119. (latest release)<!----></span><br><br>This should cause a crash.<span class="line"><!---->This should cause a crash.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by m-y...@github.com (Feb 2, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Vulnerability Details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability Details<!----></span><br><br>When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Maybe<uint32_t> ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<span class="line"><!---->Maybe&lt;uint32_t&gt; ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<!----></span><br>    Handle<JSObject> object, SerializationTag end_tag,<span class="line"><!---->    Handle&lt;JSObject&gt; object, SerializationTag end_tag,<!----></span><br>    bool can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->    bool can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  // Fast path (following map transitions).<span class="line"><!---->  // Fast path (following map transitions).<!----></span><br>  if (can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    while (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->    while (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>      ...<span class="line"><!---->      ...<!----></span><br>      } else {<span class="line"><!---->      } else {<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>        if (key->IsString(isolate_)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (key-&gt;IsString(isolate_)) {<!----></span><br>          key =<span class="line"><!---->          key =<!----></span><br>              isolate_->factory()->InternalizeString(Handle<String>::cast(key));<span class="line"><!---->              isolate_-&gt;factory()-&gt;InternalizeString(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key));<!----></span><br>          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<span class="line"><!---->          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<!----></span><br>          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<!----></span><br>                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle<String>::cast(key))<span class="line"><!---->                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key))<!----></span><br>                              .ToHandle(&target);                                  //<------ 1.<span class="line"><!---->                              .ToHandle(&amp;target);                                  //&lt;------ 1.<!----></span><br>        } else {<span class="line"><!---->        } else {<!----></span><br>          transitioning = false;<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<span class="line"><!---->      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<!----></span><br>      Handle<Object> value;<span class="line"><!---->      Handle&lt;Object&gt; value;<!----></span><br>      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&value)) return Nothing<uint32_t>();             //<------- 2.<span class="line"><!---->      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&amp;value)) return Nothing&lt;uint32_t&gt;();             //&lt;------- 2.<!----></span><br><br>      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<span class="line"><!---->      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<!----></span><br>      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<span class="line"><!---->      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<!----></span><br>      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<span class="line"><!---->      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<!----></span><br>      if (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<span class="line"><!---->        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<!----></span><br>        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<span class="line"><!---->        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<!----></span><br>        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //<-------- 3.<span class="line"><!---->        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //&lt;-------- 3.<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br><br>      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //<-------- 4.<span class="line"><!---->      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //&lt;-------- 4.<!----></span><br>      num_properties = static_cast<uint32_t>(properties.size());<span class="line"><!---->      num_properties = static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(properties.size());<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<span class="line"><!---->At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<!----></span><br>1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<span class="line"><!---->1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<!----></span><br>2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<span class="line"><!---->2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<!----></span><br><br>A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<span class="line"><!---->A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<!----></span><br>1. Create two objects with the following structure:<span class="line"><!---->1. Create two objects with the following structure:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj.c = {};<span class="line"><!---->obj.c = {};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<span class="line"><!---->This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<span class="line"><!---->Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr0 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr0 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr0.a1 = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->arr0.a1 = 1.1;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<span class="line"><!---->and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr_i = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr_i = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr_i.a1 = 1;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i.a1 = 1;<!----></span><br>arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Then create a message object as an array:<span class="line"><!---->Then create a message object as an array:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>[obj0, obj1] <span class="line"><!---->[obj0, obj1] <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>where `obj1` is:<span class="line"><!---->where `obj1` is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj1 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj1 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj1.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj1.c = arr;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.c = arr;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<span class="line"><!---->and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<!----></span><br><br>When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<span class="line"><!---->in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<span class="line"><!---->MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<span class="line"><!---->      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<!----></span><br>    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <span class="line"><!---->    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407<a           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Questionnaire 1:<span class="line"><!---->Questionnaire 1:<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1. We haven't heard of any stability regressions.<span class="line"><!---->Low stability risk. We haven't heard of any stability regressions.<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
      Vulnerability Details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability Details<!----></span><br><br>When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When deserializing Javascript objects, the function `ReadJSObjectProperties`[1] will try to create a map using existing transitions:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Maybe<uint32_t> ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<span class="line"><!---->Maybe&lt;uint32_t&gt; ValueDeserializer::ReadJSObjectProperties(<!----></span><br>    Handle<JSObject> object, SerializationTag end_tag,<span class="line"><!---->    Handle&lt;JSObject&gt; object, SerializationTag end_tag,<!----></span><br>    bool can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->    bool can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  // Fast path (following map transitions).<span class="line"><!---->  // Fast path (following map transitions).<!----></span><br>  if (can_use_transitions) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (can_use_transitions) {<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    while (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->    while (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>      ...<span class="line"><!---->      ...<!----></span><br>      } else {<span class="line"><!---->      } else {<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>        if (key->IsString(isolate_)) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (key-&gt;IsString(isolate_)) {<!----></span><br>          key =<span class="line"><!---->          key =<!----></span><br>              isolate_->factory()->InternalizeString(Handle<String>::cast(key));<span class="line"><!---->              isolate_-&gt;factory()-&gt;InternalizeString(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key));<!----></span><br>          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<span class="line"><!---->          // Don't reuse |transitions| because it could be stale.<!----></span><br>          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = TransitionsAccessor(isolate_, *map)<!----></span><br>                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle<String>::cast(key))<span class="line"><!---->                              .FindTransitionToField(Handle&lt;String&gt;::cast(key))<!----></span><br>                              .ToHandle(&target);                                  //<------ 1.<span class="line"><!---->                              .ToHandle(&amp;target);                                  //&lt;------ 1.<!----></span><br>        } else {<span class="line"><!---->        } else {<!----></span><br>          transitioning = false;<span class="line"><!---->          transitioning = false;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br><br>      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<span class="line"><!---->      // Read the value that corresponds to it.<!----></span><br>      Handle<Object> value;<span class="line"><!---->      Handle&lt;Object&gt; value;<!----></span><br>      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&value)) return Nothing<uint32_t>();             //<------- 2.<span class="line"><!---->      if (!ReadObject().ToHandle(&amp;value)) return Nothing&lt;uint32_t&gt;();             //&lt;------- 2.<!----></span><br><br>      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<span class="line"><!---->      // If still transitioning and the value fits the field representation<!----></span><br>      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<span class="line"><!---->      // (though generalization may be required), store the property value so<!----></span><br>      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<span class="line"><!---->      // that we can copy them all at once. Otherwise, stop transitioning.<!----></span><br>      if (transitioning) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (transitioning) {<!----></span><br>        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<span class="line"><!---->        // Deserializaton of |value| might have deprecated current |target|,<!----></span><br>        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<span class="line"><!---->        // ensure we are working with the up-to-date version.<!----></span><br>        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //<-------- 3.<span class="line"><!---->        target = Map::Update(isolate_, target);                                  //&lt;-------- 3.<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br><br>      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //<-------- 4.<span class="line"><!---->      CommitProperties(object, map, properties);                                 //&lt;-------- 4.<!----></span><br>      num_properties = static_cast<uint32_t>(properties.size());<span class="line"><!---->      num_properties = static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(properties.size());<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<span class="line"><!---->At (1), a the transitiion tree is searched to find suitable transition as the new object map. Then at (2), the value of the property is read, which may involve new object creation. This, in particular, may deprecate the `target` map and change the structure of the transition tree. To take this potential change into account, the `target` map is updated in (3), as the comment suggests.<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that, updating a deprecated map may result in it being normalized into a dictionary map, while the subsequence code in (4) assumes the map has fast properties. By crafting an object such that:<!----></span><br>1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<span class="line"><!---->1. At (2), the target map becomes deprecated after the value of the property is serialized<!----></span><br>2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<span class="line"><!---->2. At (3), the migration causes `target` to become a dictionary map<!----></span><br><br>A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<span class="line"><!---->A type confusion between fast properties and dictionary properties will be created. This, for example, can be done as follows:<!----></span><br>1. Create two objects with the following structure:<span class="line"><!---->1. Create two objects with the following structure:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj.c = {};<span class="line"><!---->obj.c = {};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<span class="line"><!---->This object, when deserialized, creates the following transitions in the target context:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<span class="line"><!---->Next create an array of objects as follows. The first element of the array is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr0 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr0 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr0.a1 = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->arr0.a1 = 1.1;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<span class="line"><!---->and the rest of the elements are of the following structures:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>arr_i = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->arr_i = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>arr_i.a1 = 1;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i.a1 = 1;<!----></span><br>arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<span class="line"><!---->arr_i['b' + i] = 2;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Then create a message object as an array:<span class="line"><!---->Then create a message object as an array:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>[obj0, obj1] <span class="line"><!---->[obj0, obj1] <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>where `obj1` is:<span class="line"><!---->where `obj1` is:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>obj1 = {a : 1};<span class="line"><!---->obj1 = {a : 1};<!----></span><br>obj1.a1 = 2;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.a1 = 2;<!----></span><br>obj1.c = arr;<span class="line"><!---->obj1.c = arr;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<span class="line"><!---->and `arr` contains the elements `arr0,...,arr_i`.<!----></span><br><br>When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<span class="line"><!---->When this object is deserialized, `obj0` will be deserialized first, which will create the transitions:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>{a : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -> {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<span class="line"><!---->{a : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1 : SMI} -&gt; {a: SMI, a1: SMI, c: Tagged}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<span class="line"><!---->in the target context. Then, when `obj1` is deserialized, all of its maps will be found via these transitions. So when the last field, `c` is deserialized in `obj1`, `transitioning`[2] will be set to true. After this, `ReadObject` is called to deserialize the value of `c`, which is the array `arr`. When the first element in `arr`, `arr0` is deserialized, the `target` map becomes deprecated due to the incompatible representation in `a1` (from SMI to double). This removes the transition to `c` from the transition tree. After this, the objects `arr_i` are deserialized, which will insert new transitions from `a1` to `bi` in the new map. By controlling the number of these new transitions, it is possible to create a situation such that, when the `target` map is updated and `ConstructNewMap`[3] is called, the `split_map`, which is the new map containing `a`, `a1` and all the transitions to the `bi`, cannot have anymore transition inserted. This then cause the updated map to become normalized and turned into a dictionary map:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<span class="line"><!---->MapUpdater::State MapUpdater::ConstructNewMap() {<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (maybe_transition.is_null() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<span class="line"><!---->      !TransitionsAccessor::CanHaveMoreTransitions(isolate_, split_map)) {<!----></span><br>    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <span class="line"><!---->    return Normalize("Normalize_CantHaveMoreTransitions");               <!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d;l=2407<!----></a><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/value-serializer.cc;l=2455;drc=2a7fa9b6065bba9cbe273ddc4f5e5a4a51bb450d<!----></a><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/map-updater.cc;l=275<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/map-updater.cc;l=275"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ed7dcb0b9e64a3e72beff2bd0d358398f959e5d2:v8/src/objects/map-updater.cc;l=275<!----></a><br><br>Reproduction Case<span class="line"><!---->Reproduction Case<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, run the attached `test_ser.js` with `d8`:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>./d8 test_ser.js<span class="line"><!---->./d8 test_ser.js<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The attached `test_ser.html` is also tested on the official build of Chrome version 109.0.5414.119. (latest release)<span class="line"><!---->The attached `test_ser.html` is also tested on the official build of Chrome version 109.0.5414.119. (latest release)<!----></span><br><br>This should cause a crash.<span class="line"><!---->This should cause a crash.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: d8 main branch commit de4e492 and Chrome 109.0.5414.119<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This high+ V8 security issue with stable impact requires a lightweight post mortem. Please take some time to answer questions asked in this form [1] to help us improve V8 security. [1] <span class="line"><!---->This high+ V8 security issue with stable impact requires a lightweight post mortem. Please take some time to answer questions asked in this form [1] to help us improve V8 security.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

});
</script>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
